text: Barbara Jean McNair (born 4 March 1934 â€“ 4 February 2007) was an American musician and actress. She became very popular in the 1960s. She was a guest on many television programs, including The Bell Telephone Hour, The Steve Allen Show and The Hollywood Palace. Her Broadway play credits included No Strings and The Body Beautiful in the 1960s and 1970s. McNair was born in Chicago. Around her seventies, she lived in Los Angeles. She died there resulting from throat cancer, age seventy-two. Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from Chicago Category:1934 births Category:2007 deaths
title: Barbara McNair
